SYSTEM: OWS_-_03_-_OntologyLanguages.pdf: Página 11
© O. Corcho
11
Ontological Engineering
RDF and URIs
•
RDF uses URIRefs (Unique Resource Identifiers
References) to identify resources.
–
A URIRef consists of a URI and an optional Fragment Identifier separated 
from the URI by the hash symbol #.
–
Examples
• http://www.co-ode.org/people#hasColleague
• coode:hasColleague
•
A set of URIRefs is known as a vocabulary
–
E.g., the RDF Vocabulary 
•
The set of URIRefs used in describing the RDF concepts: rdf:Property,
rdf:Resource, rdf:type, etc.
–
The RDFS Vocabulary 
•
The set of URIRefs used in describing the RDF Schema language: rdfs:Class, 
rdfs:domain, etc.
–
The ‘Pizza Ontology’ Vocabulary 
•
pz:hasTopping, pz:Pizza, pz:VegetarianPizza, etc.
speaker: SYSTEM
